        Creates a new CustomerFacade.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public java.util.List<Customer> get(Constraint<CustomerColumn>... constraints)
        Returns the customers in the application. The results can be constrained using the provided constraints.
        Parameters:
        constraints - The constraints that modify the resulting list.
        Returns:
        The resulting customers.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - When an exception occurs while performing the operation.

      • first

        public Customer first(Constraint<CustomerColumn>... constraints)
        Returns the first customer matching the provided constraints.
        Parameters:
        constraints - The constraints that modify the resulting list.
        Returns:
        The first customer matching the provided constraints. Returns null when no constraints matches the provided constraints.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - When an exception occurs while performing the operation.

      • confirm

        public void confirm(int id,
                    java.lang.String token)
             throws IncorrectTokenException,
                    ExpiredTokenException
        Confirms the membership matching the provided token details.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the token.
        token - The secret token.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException
        IncorrectTokenException
        ExpiredTokenException

      • update

        public boolean update(int id,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String address,
                      java.lang.String email,
                      java.lang.String phone,
                      java.lang.String password,
                      boolean active)
               throws CustomerValidatorException
        Updates the entity in the application to match the provided customer.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the customer to update.
        name - The new name.
        address - The new address.
        email - The new email.
        phone - The new phone.
        password - The new password.
        active - The new active status.
        Returns:
        true if the record was updated.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - When an exception occurs while performing the operation.
        CustomerValidatorException - When the provided customer information is considered invalid.

      • register

        public Customer register(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String address,
                         java.lang.String email,
                         java.lang.String phone,
                         java.lang.String password,
                         boolean active)
                  throws CustomerValidatorException
        Inserts a new customer into the application.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the customer to create.
        address - The address of the customer to create.
        email - The email address of the customer to create.
        phone - The phone number of the customer to create.
        password - The password of the customer to create.
        active - Whether or not the customer can be applied to orders.
        Returns:
        The customer instance representing the newly created customer.
        Throws:
        CustomerValidatorException - When the provided details are invalid.
        ApplicationException - When an exception occurs while performing the operation.

      • authenticate

        public Customer authenticate(java.lang.String email,
                             java.lang.String password)
                      throws InactiveCustomerException
        Attempts to authenticate a customer using the provided email and password.
        Parameters:
        email - The email to authenticate with.
        password - The password to authenticate with.
        Returns:
        The customer who was authenticated. null in case no customer with the provided credentials exist.
        Throws:
        InactiveCustomerException - When the provided customer is marked inactive.

      • sendPasswordReset

        public void sendPasswordReset(java.lang.String email)
                       throws UnknownEmailException,
                              InactiveCustomerException
        Sends an email to the provided email address containing a link where the customer can reset their password.
        Parameters:
        email - The email address to send the password reset link to.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - When a generic exception occurs.
        UnknownEmailException - When the provided email is not registered with the application.
        InactiveCustomerException - When the customer with the provided email is inactive, and can therefor not reset their password.

      • resetPassword

        public void resetPassword(int tokenId,
                          java.lang.String tokenSecret,
                          java.lang.String newPassword)
                   throws IncorrectTokenException,
                          ExpiredTokenException
        Attempts to reset the password of some customer using the provided token and the new password.
        Parameters:
        tokenId - The id of the token.
        tokenSecret - The secret token.
        newPassword - The new password.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - When a generic exception occurs.
        IncorrectTokenException - When the provided token credentials are incorrect.
        ExpiredTokenException - When the provided token exists, but have expired.

      • size

        public int size()
         throws ApplicationException
        Returns the number of customers in the data storage.
        Returns:
        The number of customers in the data storage.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - When a data storage exception occurs while performing the operation.
